text: <extra_id_0> SHARPIN <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> Is Essential for Cytokine Production , NF-kappaB Signaling , and Induction of Th1 Differentiation by Dendritic Cells

Spontaneous mutations of the <extra_id_0> Sharpin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> SHANK-associated RH domain-interacting protein <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , other aliases : <extra_id_0> Rbckl1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> Sipl1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) gene in mice result in systemic inflammation that is characterized by chronic proliferative dermatitis and dysregulated secretion of T helper1 ( Th1 ) and Th2 cytokines .
The cellular and molecular mechanisms underlying this inflammatory phenotype remain elusive .

Dendritic cells may contribute to the initiation and progression of the phenotype of <extra_id_0> SHARPIN <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - deficient mice because of their pivotal role in innate and adaptive immunity .
Here we show by flow cytometry that <extra_id_0> SHARPIN <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - deficiency did not alter the distribution of different DC subtypes in the spleen .

In response to TOLL-like receptor ( TLR ) agonists LPS and poly I : C , cultured bone marrow-derived dendritic cells ( BMDC ) from WT and mutant mice exhibited similar increases in expression of co-stimulatory molecules <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> CD80 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> CD86 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

However , stimulated <extra_id_0> SHARPIN <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - deficient BMDC had reduced transcription and secretion of pro-inflammatory mediators <extra_id_0> IL6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , IL12P70 , <extra_id_0> GMCSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and nitric oxide .

text: Mutant BMDC had defective activation of NF-kappaB signaling , whereas the <extra_id_0> MAPK1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> ERK1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) and <extra_id_0> MAPK11 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> 12 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> 13 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> 14 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( p38 MAP kinase isoforms ) and <extra_id_0> TBK1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signaling pathways were intact .
A mixed lymphocyte reaction showed that mutant BMDC only induced a weak Th1 immune response but stimulated increased Th2 cytokine production from allogeneic naive CD4+ T cells .

In conclusion , loss of <extra_id_0> Sharpin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in mice significantly affects the immune function of DC and this may partially account for the systemic inflammation and Th2-biased immune response .
